Instruction: Cut white fish fillets into large chunks.
Chop onion, garlic, celery, and carrot.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Saut√© onion, garlic, celery, and carrot until softened.
Add dry white wine, chicken broth, crushed tomatoes, bay leaf, thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add clams, mussels, and shrimp to the pot. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until shellfish open.
Add white fish to the pot and cook for 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove bay leaf and thyme sprig.
Serve immediately with crusty bread and garnish with parsley.
